_header: He that loveth well to fare

Bod315.Transcription:
Who so loueth wel to fareEuer spend and neuer spareBot he haue
                    the more goodHis heer wol growe thurgh his hood
Bod315.Note:
Occurs with 2711, 6568, 6621.5, 4250.2; all
                    originally copied from Cornwall,  olim Launceston Priory,  a wall inscription, no longer visible.
Bod315.Editions:
Rose-Troup,  Frances. 
             “Verses in the Hall at Launceston.” 
             Devon and Cornwall Notes and Queries
         19 (1937): 154-6: 154.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Wall Verses at Launceston Priory.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         200 (1963): 338-43: 342.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 562.

NapXIIIB29.Transcription:
He that louyth welle to fareeur to spend and neuer spareBut he
                    haue the more goodHis here wol grow throw his hood
NapXIIIB29.Note:
In the right margin is ‘quod
                     More’, and at the foot of the column
                        ‘Hic pennam fixi penitet me si male
                    scripsi.’
